title: EPIC-005: Global Error Handlers - Structured Error Responses

epic.title: Cross-Cutting Concerns - Auth, Validation, Errors, Observability, Config
epic.goal: Implement production-ready concerns: JWT auth middleware, input validation, error handling, structured logging, metrics, configuration management

deliverables: Production-ready implementation strictly for this story scope
Automated tests required by acceptance criteria
Minimal documentation/README updates required to run/test the change
acceptance_criteria: Exception handlers for InsufficientTokensError (402), DialogNotFoundError (404), ValidationError (422), LLMProviderError (500/504), etc.
Error response format: {code: string, message: string, details?: object}
Log all errors with structured context (user_id, request_id, endpoint, stack trace in dev only)
Never expose stack traces in production (env var DEBUG=false)
Sanitize PII in error messages (no user content, token values)
Unit tests verify error mappings, integration tests check error response format
description: Implement FastAPI exception handlers to map domain exceptions to HTTP status codes, format error responses (code, message, details), log errors, sanitize sensitive info.
